benchmark_details.name: RusCode: Russian Cultural Code Benchmark for Text-to-Image Generation
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents the RusCode benchmark dataset for evaluating the quality of text-to-image generation containing elements of the Russian cultural code, consisting of 1250 text prompts in Russian with English translations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the cultural awareness of text-to-image generation models using a comprehensive dataset of Russian cultural concepts.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset may not represent the entirety of the Russian cultural code and includes only a limited number of prompts per subcategory.

data.source: Generated prompts and reference images sourced from open internet resources.
data.annotation: Prompts were created by a team of 13 prompt-engineers reflecting diverse perspectives.

metrics: Accuracy of representation against reference images
methodology.calculation: Quality assessment based on human judgment comparing model-generated images to reference images.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy in matching generated images with prompts indicates better cultural understanding.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison of image outputs of four models: Stable Diffusion 3, DALL-E 3, Kandinsky 3.1, and YandexART 2.
methodology.validation: Human evaluations conducted across a diverse group of participants.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset aims to represent various aspects of Russian culture but may not capture all demographic nuances.
targeted_risks.harm: Inadequately trained models may generate culturally insensitive or biased content.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Prompt-engineers were informed about the project's objectives and ethical guidelines.
